meanings.definition: A sudden outburst of anger or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Her blowup at the meeting surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The child's blowup over the lost toy was understandable.
meanings.sent3: During the game, his blowup over a small mistake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The blowup of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The blowup of frustration was like a storm brewing inside her.

meanings.sent1: The blowup of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The controlled blowup of the building was scheduled for noon.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected blowup of the balloon startled the children.
meanings.sent4: The blowup of the volcano was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The blowup of the bomb echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A photograph or image that has been enlarged.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed the blowup of the family portrait on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The blowup of the map helped them navigate the unfamiliar terrain.
meanings.sent3: The blowup of the tiny insect made it look like a giant monster.
meanings.sent4: The blowup of the painting revealed intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The blowup of the starry sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase in size or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The blowup of the balloon startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: The blowup of the storm caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The blowup of the party made it the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The blowup of the music volume made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The blowup of excitement was contagious among the crowd.
